reasoning: Hamman-Rich syndrome (acute interstitial pneumonia) is a specific form of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis/interstitial lung disease. Incidence estimates range 0.6-17.4 per 100,000 person-years globally, with typical US estimates around 7-10 per 100,000. Using 8.5 per 100,000 as reasonable midpoint estimate. Data quality moderate due to variable definitions and geographic variation in IPF incidence estimates.
source: IPF epidemiology literature; incidence estimates from multiple country-specific registries and cohort studies
